rev.comment: Undid revision 423264374 by [[Special:Contributions/Mariamaghazi|Mariamaghazi]] ([[User talk:Mariamaghazi|talk]]) This section deals only with the name of the revolution, not special dates.

==Naming==
==Naming==
â
In Egypt and also the wider Arab world, the protests and subsequent changes in the government, are mostly called the '''25 January Revolution''' ({{lang|ar|Ø«ÙØ±Ø© 25 ÙÙØ§ÙØ±}} ''Thawrat 25 YanÄyir'') and '''Rage Revolution''' ({{lang|ar|Ø«ÙØ±Ø© Ø§ÙØºØ¶Ø¨}}),and sometimes called<ref>{{cite news|journal=[[Al-Ahram]] Weekly|title=The 25 January Revolution (Special issue)|date=10â16 February 2011|url=http://weekly.ahram.org.eg/2011/1034/special.htm|accessdate=15 February 2011}}</ref> the '''Revolution of the Youth''' ({{lang|ar|Ø«ÙØ±Ø© Ø§ÙØ´Ø¨Ø§Ø¨}} ''Thawrat al-ShabÄb''), ), Freedom revolution (Ø«ÙØ±Ø© Ø­Ø±ÙØ© Thawrat Horeya), In the media it has been known as the ''18 Day Revolution''.<ref>{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.shapeshift.net/2011/02/egypts-remarkable-18-day-revolution/ |title=Egyptâs Remarkable 18 Day Revolution |publisher=Shapeshift.net |date= |accessdate=21 March 2011}}</ref>.
+
In Egypt and also the wider Arab world, the protests and subsequent changes in the government, are mostly called the '''25 January Revolution''' ({{lang|ar|Ø«ÙØ±Ø© 25 ÙÙØ§ÙØ±}} ''Thawrat 25 YanÄyir''), '''Freedom revolution''' ({{lang|ar|Ø«ÙØ±Ø© Ø­Ø±ÙØ©}} ''Thawrat Horeya''){{Citation needed}} and '''Rage Revolution''' ({{lang|ar|Ø«ÙØ±Ø© Ø§ÙØºØ¶Ø¨}}),and sometimes called<ref>{{cite news|journal=[[Al-Ahram]] Weekly|title=The 25 January Revolution (Special issue)|date=10â16 February 2011|url=http://weekly.ahram.org.eg/2011/1034/special.htm|accessdate=15 February 2011}}</ref> the '''Revolution of the Youth''' ({{lang|ar|Ø«ÙØ±Ø© Ø§ÙØ´Ø¨Ø§Ø¨}} ''Thawrat al-ShabÄb''), '''[[Nelumbo|Lotus]] Revolution'''<ref>{{cite news|url=http://articles.cnn.com/2011-01-28/world/egypt.press.club_1_saad-eddin-ibrahim-egyptian-american-egyptian-people?_s=PM:WORLD |title=Egyptian-American leaders call for U.S. support of 'Lotus Revolution' - CNN |publisher=Articles.cnn.com |date=28 January 2011 |accessdate=21 March 2011}}</ref> ({{lang|ar|Ø«ÙØ±Ø© Ø§ÙÙÙØªØ³}}) or the '''White Revolution''' ({{lang|ar|Ø§ÙØ«ÙØ±Ø© Ø§ÙØ¨ÙØ¶Ø§Ø¡}} ''al-Thawrah al-bayá¸ÄÊ¾'').<ref>{{cite web|author=|url=http://www.gulf-daily-news.com/NewsDetails.aspx?storyid=299386 |title=Business News Â» Investors See White Revolution In Egypt |publisher=Gulf Daily News |date=13 February 2011 |accessdate=21 March 2011}}</ref> In the media it has been known as the ''18 Day Revolution''.<ref>{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.shapeshift.net/2011/02/egypts-remarkable-18-day-revolution/ |title=Egyptâs Remarkable 18 Day Revolution |publisher=Shapeshift.net |date= |accessdate=21 March 2011}}</ref>
â
The different names were also given to every Friday demonstration. The names started from the Facebook events made for each of those days. The naming of each of those Fridays reflected the demands or the aim of the day.
  â
The naming started on Friday the 28th of January, the "Friday of Anger" (Ø¬ÙØ¹Ø© Ø§ÙØºØ¶Ø¨ "Gomeet ElGhadab" ) <ref>http://www.facebook.com/Egypt.Voice</ref>, and went on till Friday the 8th of April,the "Friday of Purification" (Ø¬ÙØ¹Ø©Ø§ÙØªØ·ÙÙØ± "Gomeet Eltathir") <ref>http://www.facebook.com/topic.php?uid=104224996294040&topic=22159</ref>. The names given to each of the Fridays, were sometimes disappointing, like Friday the 4th, the Friday of "Salvation" and "Leave" ( Ø¬ÙØ¹Ø© Ø§ÙØ®ÙØ§Øµ /Ø§ÙØ±Ø­ÙÙ "Gomeet Alkhals / Alrahil"), where some hoped it will be the last day before Mubarak leaves. The fact that this Friday was not the Friday of leaving as expected, lead to calling the following week the week of Endurance (Ø§Ø³Ø¨ÙØ¹ Ø§ÙØµÙÙØ¯ âEsbouâ Alsomoudâ).
  â
Other names were more playing on the emotional side of the people, by bringing up the martyrs, such as the 11th of February, the Friday of the âMartyrsâ ( âØ¬ÙØ¹Ø© Ø§ÙØ´ÙØ¯Ø§Ø¡âGomeet Alshohada"), as well as, the 18th of February, the Friday of Loyalty (Ø¬ÙØ¹Ø© Ø§ÙÙÙØ§Ø¡âGomeet Alwafaâ), which was dedicated to the martyrs as well as the goals of the Egyptian Revolution <ref>http://www.facebook.com/event.php?eid=100203806725742</ref><ref>http://www.facebook.com/album.php?id=126166070784866&aid=20689#!/photo.php?fbid=129458430455630&set=a.126166517451488.20689.126166070784866&theater</ref>.
  â   â
Finally some days, had motivating names, like the 8th of April, Saving the revolution Friday, (Ø¬ÙØ¹Ø© Ø§ÙÙØ§Ø° Ø§ÙØ«ÙØ±Ø© âGomeet Enkath Althawraâ).
